intro: Wittelsbachia orinocensis, commonly known as the Orinoco Wittelsbachia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy stems. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in riverine forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
